name: debarking, softwood, in forest | bark chips, wet, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11957/documentation

This dataset represents the service of debarking softwood in forest with an output of one m3. The volume is excluding bark. ;;Debarking is one process step in the technical wood production with the main function of removing bark, bast, and dirt. The process data reflects Germany/Europe standards.;;The data is mainly based on literature values.

Debarking process starts from spruce stems in forest, with bark.

This activity ends with debarked spruce stems, at forest road. 
The dataset includes tractor driven debarking. 
The dataset does not include dust emissions due to a high water content in the wood nor the natural growth process of the trees. Furthermore, the dataset does not include the environmental consequences of soil compression due to the use of heavy machines due to a lack of data
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Germany used for central Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The process refers to a tractor driven process, i.e. a mechanical and mobile debarking process. Softwood is usually debarked in the forest with movable disbarkers. ;;The amount of bark, based on the total volume of the stem with bark is about 8 to 15% for spruce (Kollmann et al., 1975 and Sell, 1997).;References:;Kollmann F. F. P., Kuenzi E. W. and Stamm A. J. (1975) Principles of Wood Science and Technology. Springer-Verl., Berlin, Heidelberg, New York.;;Sell J. (1997) Eigenschaften und Kenngrössen von Holzarten. 4. überarbeitete und erweiterte Aufl. Edition. Lig-num, Baufachverl. AG Zürich, Dietikon.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Literature Value. Residues remaining in the forest.
